about.name: Seville
about.info_text: Seville, located in the Andalusia region of Spain, is a city steeped in history, culture, and vibrant traditions. It's known for its magnificent architecture, including the stunning Alcázar palace and the Gothic Seville Cathedral. Visitors can wander through charming neighborhoods, enjoy the lively atmosphere of tapas bars, and experience the passion of flamenco. Seville's sunny climate and rich heritage make it a captivating destination.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 700,000
Region: Andalusia
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Spanish
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Seville has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. It is known for its scorching summers, with plenty of sunshine throughout the year.

attractions_card.title: Seville Cathedral
attractions_card.description: Seville Cathedral is one of the largest Gothic cathedrals in the world, known for its intricate architecture and the Giralda Tower with panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Real Alcázar of Seville
attractions_card.description: The Alcázar is a stunning royal palace complex with beautiful Mudejar and Renaissance architecture, lush gardens, and historic rooms.

attractions_card.title: Plaza de España
attractions_card.description: Plaza de España is a remarkable square with a semicircular building, bridges, and ceramic-tiled alcoves representing different provinces of Spain.

attractions_card.title: Metropol Parasol
attractions_card.description: Metropol Parasol, also known as the 'Mushrooms of Seville,' is a modern wooden structure providing shade, panoramic views, and a market.

attractions_card.title: Barrio Santa Cruz
attractions_card.description: Barrio Santa Cruz is the historic Jewish quarter of Seville, featuring narrow streets, charming squares, and traditional Andalusian architecture.

attractions_card.title: Flamenco Shows
attractions_card.description: Seville is the heart of flamenco, and visitors can enjoy passionate and soul-stirring flamenco performances at various venues.

attractions_card.title: Triana District
attractions_card.description: Triana is a vibrant district on the west bank of the Guadalquivir River, known for its ceramics, tapas bars, and lively ambience.

attractions_card.title: Torre del Oro
attractions_card.description: The Torre del Oro is a historic watchtower by the river, offering exhibits on the maritime history of Seville.

food_card.title: Tapas
food_card.description: Seville is renowned for its tapas culture, with bars and restaurants serving an array of small dishes that accompany drinks.

food_card.title: Gazpacho
food_card.description: Gazpacho is a refreshing Andalusian cold tomato soup, perfect for cooling off during hot summers.

food_card.title: Paella
food_card.description: While paella is more associated with Valencia, you can still savor this iconic Spanish dish in Seville.

food_card.title: Churros con Chocolate
food_card.description: Churros con Chocolate is a favorite Spanish treat, with fried dough served with thick, rich, and luscious chocolate sauce. The crispy churros pair perfectly with the sweet and velvety chocolate, making it a beloved indulgence in Spain and around the world.

food_card.title: Flan
food_card.description: Flan is a delightful Spanish dessert, a caramel custard that provides a sweet and creamy ending to your meal.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Alfonso XIII
hotels_card.description: Hotel Alfonso XIII is a historic and luxurious hotel with a central location, offering grand accommodations and impeccable service.

hotels_card.title: EME Catedral Hotel
hotels_card.description: EME Catedral Hotel is a boutique hotel in the heart of Seville, known for its rooftop bar and views of the cathedral.

hotels_card.title: Las Casas de la Judería
hotels_card.description: Las Casas de la Judería is a charming hotel located in the historic Jewish quarter, offering a unique and traditional stay.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Mercer Sevilla
hotels_card.description: Hotel Mercer Sevilla is a boutique hotel with a blend of modern design and historic architecture, providing a comfortable retreat.

transport_card.title: Seville Airport
transport_card.description: Seville Airport is the main international gateway to the city, serving both domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Seville Metro
transport_card.description: Seville Metro is a convenient way to access various parts of the city, including popular attractions and neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Public Buses
transport_card.description: Seville's public bus network provides accessible transportation, making it easy to explore the city and its surroundings.

transport_card.title: Trams in Seville
transport_card.description: Seville has a modern tram system that offers an additional mode of public transportation for visitors and residents.

transport_card.title: Taxis in Seville
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Seville and are a convenient way to travel around the city, especially for reaching specific destinations.

transport_card.title: Bike Rentals
transport_card.description: Seville offers bike rental services, allowing you to explore the city on two wheels and enjoy its bike-friendly infrastructure.
